hierarchy.file_name: Impact--Add immutable access logs for issue objects and linked evidence.docx

sections.text:
This feature adds workspace-scoped, immutable access logs for sensitive “issue” objects and any linked evidence, covering both reads and writes. Each log entry will capture who did what and when, plus contextual metadata like source IP address and user agent where available. The intent is to provide a reliable audit trail across issue content, evidence snippets, and key decision/status fields that commonly drive compliance and operational reviews.

From a customer impact perspective, this materially improves trust, governance, and compliance readiness (e.g., internal audits, regulated workflows, incident postmortems). Admins will be able to answer questions like “Who viewed this issue?”, “When was the decision changed?”, and “Was evidence accessed by an unexpected actor?” with defensible, tamper-resistant records. This reduces risk in environments where access to investigative or sensitive material must be provable.

On the product surface, we’ll introduce an admin-facing API/UI endpoint for audit review, enabling search and filtering by actor, issue, time range, and action type. This makes the logs actionable (not just stored), supporting routine compliance checks, escalations, and forensic investigations without requiring database access or ad hoc engineering support.

Operationally, logs will be stored in an append-only table and retained according to each workspace’s retention settings, referencing the existing retention framework (GOLD-189) rather than duplicating it. This approach minimizes data policy fragmentation while ensuring audit data is durable, consistent with customer retention expectations, and scalable as access volume grows.
